14th st, bet Main and Franklin. fe 28--1t*

div3.head: Mrs. D R Esines,
div3.p:
fashionable and Cloak Maker, Clay between Munford and Gilmer streets, respectfully share of the patronage of the ladies of Richmond and vicinity.
All work done by fit guaranteed.
Fourth door from Munford street.

div3.head: Substitute wanted.
div3.p:
--For a man now in service.
No one need apply over 45 years of age of good character, and be . For one that will suit a liberal price will be paid.--Apply at the Monticello House, No. 56 Main street this day, as early as possible.

div3.head: Substitute wanted
div3.p:
--For which a liberal price will be paid.
Call at this office at 12 o'clock to-day.

div3.head: Runaway.
div3.p: --A reward of $25 each will be paid for the apprehension and delivery of the following slavers:
Martin, a mulatto, the property of Capt. John Page, of Hanover county, who ranaway is January last from the employment of Fortes Mason & Harman, of this city.

Richard a carpenter, the property of Dr. J. Wilcon, of Charles City county.
Richard was hired to Mr. W. M. Allen, Builder, of this city two or three months before Christmas.

div3.head:
[from the Southern Field and Fireside.] the Rainbow dream.
by Alexander means, Dd., Lld.
div3.p: The following position effusion had its origins in a singular and impressive dream which charmed a sleeping hour of the author, a few months since.

The vision was so full of poetic beauty, blended with novel grandeur, that, although he may fail to transmit to any reader the vivacious and implication of the scene, he has, nevertheless, under the promptings of his more, endeavored to embody its more luminous features, and, without claiming the faculty of Joseph to indulge in a favorable, although it may be a fanciful interpretation, which he cannot but pray Heaven may, at no distant day, find its ample realization in the providential deliverance and peerless glory of his disenthralled and rejoicing country. A. H.

lg.l: It was night on the plain, and the village was still;
Not a wing was about on the air;
Ev'ry wheat was at rest in the neighboring mill,
And the invalid dazed in his chair.
I had prayed for the loved once, in camps far away,
And had sunk in the arms of repose.
Overpowered by the cares and the tolls of the day,
When a bright dreamy vision cross.
It was twilight, it seem'd, as I gaz'd from my room,
And beheld on the dark Southern sky
A rainbow in beauty and majesty room
O'er the billowy cloud-drifts on high.
As I stepp'd from the door, and with rapid eye-glance,
Swept the broad panoramas around--
How sublime was the pomp, through the blazing expanse,
While the atmosphere breath'd not a sound!
For in prismatic glory the heavens all smil'd,
And shone on the landscape below--
From horizon to zenith the arches were pil'd--
East, West, North and South were aglow.
Fleecy masses of vapor, d'arupted and pale,
As if taking their leave of the sky,
Floated gloomily by, ever mountain and vale,
Yet they robb'd not a bow of its dye.
For aloft in the East was the "All-seeing Eye,"
And resplendent with streamers of light;
It was burning like Constantine's Cross on the sky,
And the soul bow'd in awe at the sight.

Great God!
with what grandeur creation then shone,
In her purple, and crimson, and gold.
Was the curtain uplifted that circles the Throne,
And a scroll from the God head unroll'd?
Were the thousand bright arches that spann'd the blue dome,
The symbolic fore-tokens of peace?
Shall the tempest that beats o'er my once happy home
And the thunder of battle soon cease?
Shall the red clouds of war — rent and torn by the blast.
That Mercy shall speed from on high--
Be swept from our sky, and the sunshine at last
Kindle joy through the land, for and nigh?
Does the eye of Omniscience suspiciously beam
On the land of the orange and pine,
To encourage our faith with the glories that gleam
From a Providence truly Divine?
Then thanks for the vision — so rich and so rare--
So abounding with hope, and with God;
We shall yet about in triumph, and breath a free air,
Where the Goth and the Vandal have trod.

div3.head: In the District Court of the Confederate States of America
div3.p: for the Eastern District of Virginia, February 18th, 1863:

Ordered That the Receivers, Thomas T Gales, Henry L Brooke, John T Francis, Francis L Smith, John M Speed, Thomas H Campbell, and William A Maury, do each of them, on the 20th day of March next, render before Wm F Watson, a Commissioner of this Court, an account of all matters in his hands, or under his control, as Receiver as aforesaid, appointed under the act of Congress entitled "An act for the sequestrations of the estates, property and effects of alien enemies, and for the indemnity of citizens of the Confederate States, and persons aiding the same in the existing war with the United States, " approved August 30th, 1861; and to make and state an account and settlement, under oath of his collection of moneys and disbursements under the act aforesaid: And it is further ordered that the Marshal of this Court cause to be published in the Richmond Enquirer.
Examiner, Dispatch, and Whig, for four weeks consecutively before said day of settlement, a copy of this order and that the Clerk of this Court send a copy of one of said newspapers to the District Attorney of the Confederate States for this District.
div3.closer:
A copy — Tests:
Loftim N Ellett, Clerk. fe 19--4w

div3.head: Land, Negroes, &c., for sale.
div3.p:
--The undersigned are authorized to sell a large and well improved farm, lying in a desirable section, very near to the James River Canal, and within a convenient distance of Richmond.
It produces fine tobacco, and all other stable crops.
The improvements are good.
If desired, the Slaves and Stock would be sold with the land.
A reasonable price will be taken for all the property.
Apply to
div3.closer:
W & W S Peters,
Com'n Merchants, 18th st, South of Cary,
Richmond Va. Ja 27--6&1n2w

div3.head: Camp near fort Royal, January 30, 1863.
div3.p: Arrest the Deserters — The usual reward of $30 will be paid for the arrest and delivery to me, or to the officer in command of Castle Thunder, Richmond city, of the following deserters from Company "A," 8th Regiment Louisiana Volunteers:

list.item:
1. Private Jas Boyd, a native of Ireland, about 52 years of age, red hair and heard, ruddy complexion, marked by the small pox, somewhat over 6 feet in height, and a teamster by occupation.
He is supposed to have joined a Virginia cavalry company.
2. Private Jno H Cummins, a native of New York State, 21 years old, light hair, no beard, fair complexion, blue eyes, about 5 feet 7 inches high, and a painter by trade.
3. Private Patrick Donchoe, a native of Ireland, about 37 years old, light black hair, ruddy complexion, quick of speech and motion, about 5 feet 5½ inches high, and a gardener by trade.
4. Private Patrick Fitzgerald, a native of Ireland, near 40 years of age, black hair and beard, slightly bald, black eyes, about 5 feet 8 or 9 inches high, and a day laborer.

5. Private Wm Reagan, a native of New York State, 30 years old, auburn hair, hazel eyes, stout built some 5 feet 7 inches high, and a blacksmith by trade.
He deserted in the early part of last June, and is supposed to be in Richmond city, as I lately received a notice from Capt West, one of the Quartermasters of that city, that he had paid him $174.58 as pay, bounty, and clothing money.
I will add $20 for Reagan's arrest, thus making the reward in his case $50.

closer.signed: Capt Co. A. 8th Reg La Vols.

div3.head: Notices.
div3.p: --In accordance with Special Orders, No. 39, from the Adjutant and Inspector-General's Office, I am now in Powhatan on recruiting service, and announce the partial suspension of the Conscript law, so as to permit conscripts to volunteer in the companies of their own selection, without passing through camps of instruction, and to receive the bounty and other benefits provided by law for volunteers.

It is useless for me to make an appeal to your patriotism.
The desolate condition of the fairest portion of your State speaks in stronger terms than anything I could say. Come forward, then, one and all, and volunteer at once, that the vile invader may be swept from the sacred soil of your native State.
Any one within the conscript age who will come forward and volunteer will have the privilege of attending himself to any company he may select, and will be furnished with transportation to the company on application to me. He will also receive $50 bounty and all other benefits proposed by law in such cases.

div3.head: Three hundred Dollars reward.
div3.p:
I will pay $300 in cash to any one who will arrest Michael Rooney, who deserted from my company last night after having regularly entered as a substitute three days before.
He is a short, thick-built Irishman and wore, when he left, a pair of blue Yankee pants, citizen's coat, and a black wool hat, badly worn; he is 46 or 47 years old and has generally worked on railroads, he once lived in Alexandria; has recently lived in Richmond, where it is said he has a wife and two children.
The above reward will be paid to any one who will lodge him in Castle Thunder or any other prison, and notify me of the same, or for his head, should he resist arrest.
div3.closer:
Wm T Nicholson,
Capt comd'g Co. E, 37th N G Reg't,
Lane's Brigade, A P Hill's Div.
February 20th, 1863. fe 24--2w

div3.head: Five hundred Dollars reward.
div3.p: --Deserted from comp'y E, 26th Virginia reg't, on the 1st inst, Henry Scott, an Irishman about 47 years old, about 5 feet 6½ inches high; dark-brown or black hair; bluish eyes; dark complexion; has a ship tattooed on his breast, a woman on each arm, the woman on the left arm has a child in her arms; has a star on the back of the left hand, and has lost a portion of the middle finger of the right hand.--Henry Scott was mustered as a substitute for Robt Edmundam of Halifax Co., Va. The above reward will be paid for his delivery to me at the camp of the 26th Virginia regiment, Wise's brigade, near Chaffin's Bluff.

closer.signed: John T Perrin, Capt Co B,

div3.head: Ninety Dollars reward.
div3.p: --Deserted from Co O 53d Va Reg't.--
Isaac King, complexion dark, hair dark, eyes blue, height 5 feet 7 inches, slight scar on the left cheek.

George Ellis, age 46 years, complexion dark, hair dark and slightly gray, eyes blue, height 5 feet 4½ inches, bottom front teeth large and irregular; supposed to be lurking about Chesterfield Coal Pits.
The above reward will be paid for their delivery at Castle Thunder, or $45 for either.

div3.head: Hdq'rs Mallory Troop, Richmond, February 20th, 1863.
div3.p:
A Few more Recruits are wanted to fill up my company of Cavalry, to serve as Gen. Lee's Body Guard.
Horses, equipment, a complete outfit, and $50 bounty, furnished to each recruit — Those wishing to join this corps will report to me at Mr. Thos T Johnson's office opposite Columbian Hotel, or to Lieut David Johnson, at Camp Lee, by the 5th of March as no recruits will be received after that time.

div3.head: Deserted
div3.p: --From Dabacy's Heavy Field Artillery--
Wm A Norton, 19 years of age; 5 feet 8½ inches high; dark hair; dark blue eyes, scar on right lip; a sore on left ankle; born in Fredericksburg.
Geo H Montford, 21 years of age; 5 feet 7½ inches high; light hair; gray eyes; born in Stanton, Maryland.
They both left the company at Halifax on the 16th inst. The usual reward of $30 will be paid for their arrest.

div3.head: Deserted
div3.p:
--On or about the 20th of June last, John Forsee, a member of Comp'y F, 18th Georgia reg't. He was enlisted at Richmond on the 12th of October, 1861; has dark eyes; black hair; is about 5 feet 11 inches high, and is supposed to be in Powhatan county.
A reward of $30 will be paid for his arrest, and delivery to some proper officer.

closer.signed: John F Hardin, Lt com'g Co F,

div3.head: Deserted
div3.p: --$100 reward.--Deserted from Capt Wm L Lane's Company, 7th Confederate Hangers, Jos F Bell, a Substitute, between 16 and 18 years of age, five feet two inches high, light hair, and has a large scar on the left jaw. The above reward will be given for his delivery to S C Lewis, Enfield, Halifax county, N C, or lodged in any jail so that he can be gotten.

div3.head: Thirty Dollars reward
div3.p:
--Will be paid for the apprehension and delivery at Marine Camp, Drewry's Bluff, of Wm Myers, a deserter from the C S Marine Corps.
He is 23 years of age, 5 feet 8¼ inches high, blue eyes, light hair, fair complexion.
He had been wounded in the left hand, supposed in escaping from Camp Lee, where he had engaged himself as a substitute.
div3.closer:
A S Taylor,
Major and Q M C S M C,
Office 115 Broad st. fe 12--6t

div3.head: Notice to conscripts
div3.p: --The Medical Examining Board for the 3d Congressional District is now holding its session at the Camp of Instruction, near Richmond.
All persons of conscript age, who have been authorized to appear before this Board for final examination, will report immediately.
div3.closer:
John A Coke, Capt and Enroll'g Officer
3d Congressional District. 1--ts

div3.head: Substitute wanted
div3.p:
--To go in the infantry--company B, 1st Virginia regiment.
For an unexceptionable Substitute a liberal price will be paid.
Address "R B A," at this office.

div3.head: Substitute wanted
div3.p:
--For the balance of the war. For one over forty-five years of age, with reliable testimonials, a liberal price will be paid.
Apply at the store No. 9 Fourteenth st., between Main and Cary.

div3.head: Substitute wanted
div3.p:
--One over 45 years of age, of good character, and sound health.--The highest price will be given.
Apply at No. 151 Main street.

div3.head: Substitute wanted.
div3.p:
--Wanted, a Substitute, to go in a No. 1 artillery company.
None need apply unless he is over 45 years old, sound and healthy, and with a character well endorsed.
For such an one a liberal price will be paid.
A Virginian preferred.
Apply at the office corner of Wall and Franklin sts, to

div3.head: Substitute wanted.
div3.p:
--$2,000 will be given for a sound and reliable man over 45 years of age, to go as a Substitute in a No. 1 infantry company.
Apply at the Saw Mill, Mayo's Bridge.

div3.head: Substitute wanted
div3.p: --Over 45 years old. One of sound health and good moral character will be paid a liberal price by caliber at
div3.closer:
Davidson & Chockley's.
Cary street, 3 doors below 13th st.
Richmond, Va. fe 11--da

div3.head: Two hundred Dollars reward.
div3.p: --The following Negroes runaway from the Carbon Hill Mines, in this county, on the 15th inst, viz:

Harry Williams, a dark brown negro, 5 feet 9¾ inches in height, not very stout, good looking about 32 years old, varicose veins in both legs, left leg most effected, lately purchased from Green county, N C.

Ben Williams, dark brown, 5 feet 6 inches high, very stout, round face, very likely, about 25 years old, just recovered from a serious attack of pneumonia, lately purchased from Jones & States, and came from Green county, N C.

Jim Lawrence, a black negro, 5 feet 3 inches in height, remarkably broad across the shoulders, and powerfully made, about 30 or 32 years old, good teeth, countenance indicating shrewdness and rascality, a shot mark in the right leg, lately purchased, and came from near Goldsborough, N C.

George Holy, a brown negro, 5 feet 8 inches high about 25 years old, good teeth, eyes rather close together, not stout, has a scar from a severe wound inside of his left hand, was a fireman on one of the North Carolina railroads for four years, comes from Goldsborough, N C.

Ryall Griffin, (or Rhins,) a light brown negro, 5 feet 7 inches in height, round shoulders, heavy brown, slim figure, and indifferent looking, was under medical treatment when he left for a chronic disease is about 32 years old, came from near Goldsborough, N C.

Jim is no doubt the leader of the party, and is probably endeavoring to reach the Yankee lines near Goldsborough.
They carried an axe with them.

For the apprehension and delivery to me in Richmond or either of these negroes I will pay $10 if taken in this city or county; $20 if taken in an adjoining county; or $40 if taken up thirty miles from Richmond in any direction.

div3.head: Ran away
div3.p:
--$100 reward.--Ran away from the subscriber, on the 18th inst, Annie Banions, taking with her some $280 in C S notes and $220 in gold.
She is in all probability lurking about the city and has been seen near the Medical College, and between that and Vistor's Mill.
The above reward will be paid for her delivery to me in Richmond with the money, or $50 for her alone.
Description: Bright mulatto, about five feet high, and rather stout; aged 17 years; has bushy hair of a reddish tinge, and large and good front teeth.

div3.head: Ran away
div3.p:
--From the City Gen Works, on the 16th of February, 1863, four negro men — Nat Boykin, Bob Harkis Jim Pollard, and John Rose.
Nat is thick set, dark skin and five feet four inches high.
Bob is stout, dark skin and five feet seven and a half inches high.
Jim is spare made, dark skin, and five feet seven inches high.
John is spare made, dark skin, and five feet seven inches high.
A liberal reward will be paid for of either or all of them at the

div3.head: One hundred Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--The above reward will be paid for the apprehension and securing, so that I get them, of two negroes, Taylor and Rose, who left my promises about the 1st of May, 1862, or $50 for either of them.
My boy is about 15 years old dark skin, very quick and and I understand was with 11th Ga reg't, last June, and to be somewhere in Gen Longstreets with that regiment, and of "Free Bill." Rose is 22 years old and mulatto, a scar on the Cheek caused by a burn; believed to be harbored in this city.
Information left with W S Phillips, 12th street, or Dr. F W Hancock, Main street, between 3d and 4th.

div3.head: Fifty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--A young negro men, named John Chieman, who came to Richmond from Williamsburg some time last spring, and who has been hired about the city until recently, has disappeared.
Fifty dollars reward will be paid by Messrs. Blair & Chamberlayne, on Main street, if the negro shall be delivered to them, or secured in jail in Richmond to their order.
The man is about 12 years old, black, about 5 feet 7 or 8 inches tall, and quite likely.
Mr. Parkes Slater, south side of Broad street between 4th and 5th, can give information as to the acquaintance of the man amongst his own color, &c.

closer.signed: Robt A Bright, C S A.

div3.p:
I will pay a liberal reward for the arrest and delivery to me, or confinement in some jail so that I may get him, of my man Stokes, who left my house, in Amelia county, on the 18th of January, and is evidently attempting to make his escape to the Yankees, or has hired himself to work in some camp.
Stokes is about 23 years of age, 5 feet 6 or 8 inches high, black complexion, and has a large scar on his side, occasioned by a barn.
div3.closer:
Mary A Hardaway.
Damtonville F O Amelia Co. fe 18--6t*

div3.head: Forty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Left my farm near Keysville in Charlotte Co., Va, on Sunday, the 15th instant, my negro man George Braxton.
I bought him of Hill & Co, as the property of Thos A. Lacy, New Kent Co., Va, in December last.
His wife lives near Mr. Lacy's, where I suppose, he is making his way. He is a little under the medium height, black, has full whiskers, speaks rather indistinctly; had on when he left a Yankee blue overcoat and vest, black hat and patched pants.
He is about 25 years old. I will give $30 reward for him if taken between my house and Richmond, and brought to my house, or $40, if taken in Richmond or beyond that place, and lodged in jail in Richmond so that I get him again.

div3.head: Twenty Dollars reward
div3.p:
--Will be paid for the return of a small negro boy named Peter, or for any information given so that I can get him. He left my house, on Union Hill, about the 15th of January.
It is very likely he may report himself free, and apply to some of the hospitals or camps around Richmond for employment.
He has a scar under his chin from sorefuls, and one also over one eye, and is about 14 years of age.

div3.head: Notice.
div3.p:
--I am informed that my man, John, who sometimes calls himself Jno Baker, or Jno Ligon, at others calls himself Joe, was taken up recently from the army near Fredericksburg, where he was employed as a cook, and sent to some of the public of private jails in the city of Richmond.
Any information furnished me in the county of Powhatan, Jefferson Post Office, or to me at the American Hotel, No. 44, until Friday at 12 o'clock, will be liberally rewarded.
John is 23 years old, about 5 feet 2 or 3 inches high, black, has a scar on his right or left arm occasioned by a barn.
He left my residence in July last, and I presume he has been with the army until he was apprehended.
The information I have lends utmost to a certainty that he is now in the city of Richmond in jail.

div3.head: One hundred Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ran away from Wylliesburg, in Charlotte county, during the month of June, 1862, my man Bartlett.
For his apprehension and delivery to me, if taken up out of the State, I will pay the above reward; if captured within the State, and placed in jail so that I can get him, I will pay $50 Bartlett is about 20 years of age, of small stature, weighing, perhaps, 160 pounds; 5 feet 5 inches high, mahogany color, one upper tooth out in front, low forehead, and dull countenance.
When last seen he was in the vicinity of Clarksville.
div3.closer:
A. G. Jefferes,
Red Oak Grove, Va. fe 13--10t

div3.head: Ran away
div3.p:
--$100 reward.--Ran away from "Wakefield," the farm in Hanover next adjoining Mr. Geo W Doswell's, on Monday, the 9th instant, a negro man named Jim. Said negro is of dark complexion, 5 feet 8 or 10 inches high, about 23 years old, and has a defect in his right eye. He was dressed in grey clothes, and had on either boots or wooden bottomed yellow shoes.
Before leaving he spoke of going to the Junction to get with our army, and I especially request quartermasters and wagon-masters on the lines of the Central or Fredericksburg Railroads to keep a look-out for him. I will pay the above reward for his apprehension and delivery in the jail at Hanover Court House, so that I get him again; or to myself in Richmond.

closer.signed: Ex't of Mrs. Judith Smith, dec'd.

div3.head: Runaway in jail.
div3.p:
--Was committed to the jail of Henrico county, as a runaway, a negro boy named Jim, as the property of John Montgomery, of the county of York, Va. The said boy is about 18 years old, 5 feet 7 inches high, with brown skin; had on when committed a full suit of gray Virginia clothing.
The owner of said boy is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges, and take him away, or he will be dealt with as the law directs.

closer.signed: Geo D Pleasants, S H C.

div3.head: One hundred Dollars reward.
div3.p: --Ran away from the subscriber on the 1st day of February, a dark brown skin negro man, 6 feet high, named Peter, about 23 years old. I will give the above reward to any person who will bring him to me, or have him confined in any jail in the State that I may get him. He has a wife in Powhatan county, and was recently bought in Goochland county, Va.
div3.closer:
Daniel F. Ward,
Falls Plantation, Chesterfield county, Va. fe 3--2w

div3.head: Runaway
div3.p:
--$25 reward.--Ran off from the subscriber, in the city, of Richmond, on the 27th inst., a black Girl, about 14 years old, not very good teeth in front.
She was purchased of Mrs. Mary W Coleman, of Carolina county, and may be making her way back.
I will pay $25 for her arrest and delivery to Hill, Dickinson & Co.

div3.head: One hundred Dollars reward
div3.p:
--Ran away from the subscriber, on the 25th Dec'r last, my negro man Patrick.
He is about 28 years of age, about five feet, seven inches high, very black, large thick lips, his under one turns entirely over, and large feet and hands.
He has been engaged in driving from my farm, in Henrico, in the city of Richmond, for several years past.--He may be lurking about the city, or in some of the camps around.
I will give the above reward for his apprehension and return to me.

div3.head: Fifty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ranaway from the subscriber, about the 1st of November last, my negro man Charles.
The above reward will be paid to any one who will deliver him to me, on my plantation in Halifax county, near Barksdale's Depot, on the Richmond and Danville railroad, or confine him in some county jail so that he can get him. He is about 5 feet 11 inches high, gingerbread color; usually wears his hair plaited, and when not plaited has a full head of hair.
He was bought recently from Col. James W. Twyson of Madison county, Va., and it is believed he is making his way to his old neighborhood.
My post office is Whitlock, Halifax, Va.

div3.head: Two hundred and Fifty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--For my woman Vina, who escaped from the Bollingbrook Hotel, in Petersburg, the 12th of Jan'y. She had on a homespun dress.
She is about 25 years old, dark skin.
She was hired to Mr. Jno Donnan, in Petersburg, in 1862.--I bought her from Mr. Alphens A Rowlett, in Chesterfield.
She may be harbored by some person in or near Petersburg.
If so, I will give $50 in addition to the above reward for their detection.
If caught, she may be placed in jail in Petersburg of Richmond.
Address any information concerning her to H A Pharce, Richmond, Va, or Mr. Robt F Jackson, at the office of the South Side railroad, Petersburg, Va.

div3.head: One hundred Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ran away from the subscriber, on or about the 25th of July, 1862, from the camp of the 7th Georgia, my negro boy, Isaac, frequently called Monk; aged 21 years, 5 feet 5 inches high copper colored, large eyes, quick spoken quick gait.
When last heard from he was hiring himself as a free negro.
Any person who may arrest him and lodge him in any safe jail so that I can get him, shall have the above reward.
div3.closer:
John L Martin, Co A,
7th Ga Vols. fe 27--5t*

div3.head: Ten Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ranaway, on the 22d instant, from my residence, in Sidney, Henrico county, a negro boy named John, of a gingerbread color, about 11 years old. He had on a brown jacket and pantaloons.
I will give the above reward for his delivery to me.

div3.head: Twenty five Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Ranaway about the 15th of February, a black man named Miles, about 22 years old. He was purchased of W H Pleasants, on the 10th instant.
I will pay the above reward for his delivery to Morits Hill, Dickinson & Co.

div3.head: Fifty Dollars reward
div3.p:
--Absconded from my farm, near Ashland, Hanover county, about the 15th of December last, my man Joe, about 28 or 30 years of age, black complexion, 5 feet 6 or 7 inches high.
He was purchased by me in Richmond last fall, and formerly belonged to Wm Woodfin Cumberland county, about whose place he is supposed to be lurking.
I will pay the above reward if delivered to C W Coleman, near Ashland, or lodged in some jail so I get him again.
div3.closer:
W A Dick.
Ashland, Hanover county, February 13, 1863. fe 14--2tsw4w*

div3.head: Seventy-five Dollars reward
div3.p:
--Is offered for the apprehension and delivery of my slave William Henry, who disappeared from the fortification around Richmond about the 10th of December.
Said slave is about 19 years of age, 5 feet high, thick set, thick of speech, gruff in manner of speaking, and generally clears his throat before beginning has a peculiarly formed head, protuberance on the bank of it, and eyes somewhat popped.
The above reward is offered for the apprehension and delivery of said slave to me in Danville, or lodged in the jail in Richmond so that I get him in possession.
div3.closer:
Geo W. Dame,
Danville Va. fe 7--2awtw
